clinical_study.brief_title: Renal Magnetic Resonance (MR) Elastography in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Renal MR Elastography: Normal Findings and Variability of Stiffness Measurements

primary_outcome.measure: Normal kidney stiffness (measured from MRE data)
Variability of stiffness measurement (on repeat examination)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of partial and total technical failures
Quality criteria of stiffness measurements (area of the ROIs used for measurement, mean induced displacement measured in the ROIs)

intervention.description: Ten healthy volunteers will undergo MR Elastography using a pneumatic driver connected to a commercially available speaker and the stiffness of the left kidney will be measured. The examination will be repeated on the same volunteers at least one month later and the same stiffness measurements will be performed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18 and 40
- Signed informed consent form
- Insured by the French Social Security
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Personal or familial history of kidney disease
- Hypertension
- Diabetes
- Contraindication to MRI

facility.name: Department of Urinary an Vascular Radiology, Hôpital E. Herriot

results_reference.citation: Rouvière O, Souchon R, Pagnoux G, Ménager JM, Chapelon JY. Magnetic resonance elastography of the kidneys: feasibility and reproducibility in young healthy adults. J Magn Reson Imaging. 2011 Oct;34(4):880-6. doi: 10.1002/jmri.22670. Epub 2011 Jul 18.
